Question: On February 17, 1801, after thirty-six ballots, the House elected this person President and Burr Vice President.
Hints: Years before holding his first office, this person had spent much time researching procedures and rules for governing bodies.
Many historians maintain this person's debt prevented him from freeing his slaves; however, many other historians disagree.
This person's funeral was held July 5, performed by Reverend Charles Clay.
